src.model package¶

src.model.linear_regression module¶

src.model.linear_regression.predict(regressor, x_test)¶

Predict labels according to the test values x_test

Parameters

  • x_test (array-like) – values from the test dataset

  • regressor (LinearRegression) – a linear model regressor. Typically, the one returned by the train method

Returns

(DataFrame) - the labels predicted for the test values

src.model.linear_regression.train(x_train, y_train)¶

Train a linear regression-type model

Parameters

  • x_train (array-like) – values from the train dataset

  • y_train (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values from the train dataset

Returns

(LinearRegression) - sklearn regressor of the linear model

Use example¶

from model import linear_regression as lr

regressor = lr.train(x_train, y_train)
y_pred = lr.predict(regressor, x_test)

src.model.regression_tree module¶

src.model.regression_tree.predict(regressor, x_test)¶

Predict labels according to the test values x_test

Parameters

  • regressor (DecisionTreeRegressor) – a decision tree model regressor. Typically, the one returned by the train method

  • x_test (array-like) – values from the test dataset

Returns

(array-like) - the labels predicted for the test values

src.model.regression_tree.train(x_train, y_train)¶

Train a regression tree-type model

Parameters

  • x_train (array-like) – values from the train dataset

  • y_train (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values from the train dataset

Returns

(DecisionTreeRegressor) - sklearn regressor of the model

Use example¶

from model import regression_tree as rt

regressor = rt.train(x_train, y_train)
y_pred = rt.predict(regressor, x_test)
